habitat_description:
Great Plains:
Geomys texensis is a geomyid rodent endemic to central Texas. It occurs in two isloated locations within the Texas Hill Country (Smolen et al. 1993, Block and Zimmerman 1991, Cramer and Cameron 2001, Schmidly 2004). Also known as the Llano pocket gopher, it is found in deep, brown loamy sands or gravelly sandy loams and is isolated from other species of Geomys by intervening shallow, stony to gravelly clayey soils (Block and Zimmerman 1991, Schmidly 2004). Geomys t. texensis inhabits live oak-mesquite-Ashe juniper habitats; G. t. bakeri occurs in mesquite-blackbrush-desert hackberry habitats (Cameron, in Wilson and Ruff 1999).
